Posts.Content: Hi Medusa, I like your spirit. I shaved my hair off too when it really started to fall out. My sister in law bought me a bottle of champagne and we sent it off in style. I'd been so upset about it that she felt I ought to try to turn it into something more positive and to mark the moment. What was a very difficult day turned into something lighter and more positive. I sent my hair off with a glass of bubbles and vowed that I wasn't going to let this beat me. Good luck x

Posts.Content: Hi sr23 I've got the same problem as you. I've been prescribed Tranexamic Acid which are tablets that reduce heavy blood flow during menstruation. I take them from the moment my period starts and they have really helped. I'm on FEC and they don't interfere with that. By the way, I was told by my chemo nurse not to use tampons - risk of toxic shock syndrome. Just another thing I had to add to the list of things I can't do. Managing heavy periods without them is not fun. Hope you get some help. X
